patch.summary: Update an order associated with a given ID in Shopify. Change an order's attributes such as note, email, buyer-accepts-marketing, or remove the customer association. The update API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the order object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left alone. Updating an order with an ID that does not exist will result in an error response. NOTE: To remove the customer association, set the 'customer' value to null.

get.summary:
Returns a list of objects based on a set of search parameters.  Here is an example query:  select id, name			(Fields of that Object)
from contactX			(Name of Object)
where name like '%foo%' 	(Search Expression)
or name like '%bar%;		(Search Expression continued)
order by createdDate 		(Order of Search)
limit 10 			(How Many Results to Display)
offset 0 			(Where to start in the list of objects)
In this example, I am querying a list of objects from contactX containing the fields id and name where the name contains foo or bar.  The results will be in a list of 10 organized by the date they were created, starting with the earliest.

Address.description: A customer address resource instance represents one of the many addresses a customer may have

address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address

country.x-conditionally-required-description: If province or province_code is present then either country or country_code must be present

country_code.description: The two-letter country code corresponding to the customer's country
country_code.x-conditionally-required-description: If province or province_code is present then either country or country_code must be present

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the address

phone.description: The customer's phone number for this mailing address

province.description: The customer's province or state name

province_code.description: The two-letter pcode for the customer's province or state

zip.description: The customer's zip or postal code

customer_id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer

latitude.description: The latitude of the billing address

longitude.description: The longitude of the billing address

allocation_method.description: The method by which the discount application value has been allocated to entitled lines.

code.description: The discount code that was used to apply the discount.Available only for discount code applications

target_type.description: The type of line on the order that the discount is applicable on

description.description: The description of the discount application, as defined by the merchant or the Shopify Script. Available only for manual and script discount applications

target_selection.description: The lines on the order, of the type defined by target_type, that the discount is allocated over

type.description: The discount application type.Valid values:manual: The discount was manually applied by the merchant (for example, by using an app or creating a draft order).script: The discount was applied by a Shopify Script.discount_code: The discount was applied by a discount code.

title.description: The title of the discount application, as defined by the merchant. Available only for manual discount applications

value.description: The value of the discount application as a decimal. This represents the intention of the discount application

Customer.description: A customer resource instance represents a customer account with the shop.

accepts_marketing.description: Indicates whether the customer has consented to be sent marketing material via email. Valid values are true or false

addresses.description: A list of the ten most recently updated addresses for the customer

created_at.description: The date and time when the customer was created.The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format

default_address.description: The default address for the customer

email.description: The unique email address of the customer. Attempting to assign the same email address to multiple customers will return an error

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer

last_order_id.description: The id of the customer's last order

last_order_name.description: The name of the customer's last order. This is directly related to the Order's name field

orders_count.description: The number of orders associated with this customer

multipass_identifier.description: The customer's identifier used with Multipass login
